results.title: Wonders of growing plants. - 2nd. ed.
results.brief_description: Two children plant lima beans in a glass with blotting paper that soaks up water to keep the seeds moist. Time-lapse photography is used to show the growth of the plants. Other methods of growing plants, such as from roots, stems and leaves are shown. No other credits available.

results.title: Where is dead?
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Lifestyle Productions
results.brief_description:
A low-keyed drama which deals compassionately with a subject that children sometimes have to face, the death of someone they love. When six-year-old Sarah’s older brother dies suddenly, her parents must explain to her what has happened and help her cope with her feelings.
Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Vanished vikings. Part 2: Where did they go?
results.creator_credit: Edwin Morrisby, Gilbert Altschul Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description: In the 16th century European explorers found no Viking settlements in Greenland - only bones and ruins. This film introduces the leading theories about the sudden disappearance of some 9000 Viking people and follows the points of view of leading scholars. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Tomorrow's quake
results.creator_credit: Lewis C. Hall and American Educational Films
results.brief_description: This film explores efforts to develop hypotheses on earthquake prediction. Explains continental drift, dilatency, plate techtonics, earthquake mechanics, seismographs, P and S waves, Seismic velocity changes, tilimeters, ground elevation, water wells and unusual animal behaviour.

results.title: Sports for life
results.brief_description: Discusses reasons for taking up sport, such as the value of exercise for physical health, the development of self reliance and self discipline, a relaxation and break from work and the development of cooperation through the participation in team sports.

results.title: Reflections: a Japanese folk tale
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: In a tale designed to probe the many facets of perception, a young man buys a box with a mirrored bottom and sees in it the face of his dead father. On opening the box his wife sees a young rival and a holy woman sees another holy woman. Are our own perceptions distorted by self-images? Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: A Painting for people
results.brief_description: Harold Freedman was employed by the Victorian Government to paint a large mural for the Spencer Street Railway Station on the one hundred years of transport, 1835-1935. Depicts the research, hundreds of drawings and the scope of work required to complete the first part of the mural. Narrated by Harold Freedman. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Much ado about nut things: problem solving, estimation
results.brief_description: An animated film introducing the concept of estimation and suggests ways to use it in problem solving. Also illustrates the use of the calculator in estimating solutions to problems. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Measure of man
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Tony Guy and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A brief animated history of measurement which shows that measuring is arbitrary and that counting is not. The most important advantage of the metric system of measurement is the interrelationship of the units. Common metric units are whosn within their range of application.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Halas, Tony Guy and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films

results.title: The Living cell: an introduction
results.brief_description: Introduces the fundamental principles of cell biology, examining structures and biochemical processes that occur in all living cells. Suitable for lower secondary level.
